title: Provides for notification to hospital patients upon intake of reports of hospital-acquired infections
summary: Provides for notification to hospital patients upon intake of reports of hospital-acquired infections.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2052

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CUSICK -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to notifying hospital
         patients upon intake of reports of hospital-acquired infections

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 2819 of the public health law is amended by  adding
    2  a new subdivision 6-a to read as follows:
    3    6-A.  NO  LATER THAN ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY DAYS AFTER THE ISSUANCE OF THE
    4  REPORTS REQUIRED PURSUANT TO SUBPARAGRAPH  (III)  OF  PARAGRAPH  (C)  OF
    5  SUBDIVISION  FIVE  OF  THIS  SECTION,  EACH  GENERAL  HOSPITAL  SHALL BE
    6  REQUIRED TO NOTIFY PATIENTS AS A COMPONENT  OF  PREBOOKING,  INTAKE  AND
    7  REGISTRATION OF THE HOSPITAL-ACQUIRED INFECTIONS, THAT WOULD BE REQUIRED
    8  TO BE REPORTED TO THE DEPARTMENT PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, THAT OCCURRED
    9  IN THE HOSPITAL FOR THE PRIOR THIRTY DAY PERIOD. SUCH NOTIFICATION SHALL
   10  BE  UPDATED  ON  A  DAILY  BASIS  AND  SHALL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE
   11  CONSPICUOUS POSTING OF SIGNS, WHICH ARE  EASILY  UNDERSTANDABLE  BY  THE
   12  GENERAL PUBLIC, AND SHALL INCLUDE DIRECTIONS ON HOW TO OBTAIN ADDITIONAL
   13  INFORMATION.  TO  THE DEGREE PRACTICABLE, THE FORMAT OF SUCH SIGNS SHALL
   14  BE CONSISTENT WITH THE FORMAT OF THE SUMMARY TABLE REQUIRED TO BE DEVEL-
   15  OPED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION SIX  OF  THIS  SECTION.  UPON  REQUEST  THE
   16  HOSPITAL SHALL PROVIDE A PATIENT WITH AN INDIVIDUAL COPY OF THE INFORMA-
   17  TION  CONTAINED  ON  SUCH  SIGN. THE DEPARTMENT THROUGH REGULATION SHALL
   18  ESTABLISH PENALTIES APPLICABLE TO THE FIRST AND SUBSEQUENT VIOLATIONS OF
   19  THE REQUIREMENT IMPOSED BY THIS SUBDIVISION.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02097-01-1
